CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. 1, reads: "Fatal Christmas Fire - Five children of Mrs. Ruby Thomas, 38, of 138 New Arlington Ave., are temporarily housed at the home of an aunt at 619 E. Carson St., following a fire which destroyed their home and burned the mother, Mrs. Thomas, while she was putting away Christmas presents and toys for her children in a cellar washroom Sunday morning. - Harris Photo." Portion of article reads: "Mrs. Thomas was trapped and burned to death in rear cellar room.  However, all of her children and her husband, were evacuated from the blazing home.  The children are: Barbara, 14; Rheba Mae, 12, nicknamed 'Tanya'; Shirley, 11; Emaline, 10, and John Jr., 9. John Thomas Sr. is the father..."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of children from family of Ruby and John Thomas, including Barbara, Rheba Mae "Tanya," Shirley, Emaline, and John Thomas Jr., posed in living room with floral curtains
